content.webTitle: Ashley Williams gives damning assessment of Swansea’s season

fields.headline: Ashley Williams gives damning assessment of Swansea’s  season
fields.bodyText: Ashley Williams has delivered a brutally honest assessment of Swansea City’s season, with the Wales captain describing their performances as “unacceptable”, admitting the campaign has “not been enjoyable” and calling for a period of reflection in the summer to address what has gone wrong. Swansea’s narrow win over Aston Villa, courtesy of Federico Fernández’s scrappy goal,, and largely thanks to some suspect Brad Guzan goalkeeping, means they are all but safe from the threat of relegation but Williams made no attempt to try and sugarcoat a woeful display and a chaotic season. Garry Monk, Alan Curtis and Francesco Guidolin have taken charge of the team at various stages, which Williams said was “not ideal”, and there will almost certainly be another managerial change in the summer. Yet there also needs to be a radical overhaul on the pitch. Swansea have badly lost their way and it is hard to think of many occasions when they have produced the sort of refined football with which they have become synonymous ever since winning promotion to the Premier League in 2011. Against Villa, the Premier League’s bottom team, Swansea looked clueless at times. “This season’s been a grind and today kind of summed it up a little bit. We didn’t play very well but we managed to grind out a result,” Williams said. “It’s not been enjoyable, to be honest. There’s been a lot of changes with the manager, it’s not ideal. It’s kind of one you want to get it out the way, get safe, see where you can finish and try and put everything right before next season and have another good season.” Huw Jenkins, Swansea’s chairman, intends to hold a summer review and Williams, a well-respected figure at the Liberty Stadium, said that he would be more than happy to offer his opinion if asked. “I think this season is an important one, we’ve got it wrong for whatever reason and it’s unacceptable for a club like Swansea to have a season like this with the players that we’ve got. It’s such a good club, we need to do better next season, so there’s a lot of talking to be done in the summer. “The pleasing thing is that it seems we’ve got through it, we’ve done what we had to do in certain games, like the Norwich game and against Villa, where we haven’t played pretty but we’ve got the points on the board. There are many reasons why [it has gone wrong], we will all have to do a lot of reflecting, look at ourselves, look at us as a squad, what’s been going on – because there’s a lot that’s been going on. And we’ll be looking for a better season next season.” Man of the match Leon Britton (Swansea City)
